alert.note: Alert for Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:59AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Comanche, western Cotton, southeastern Jackson, south central Kiowa, Tillman, northern Wichita and central Wilbarger Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 158 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elmer to near Fargo to near Lockett. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Altus, Vernon, Burkburnett, Frederick, Walters, Cache, Electra, Snyder, Geronimo, Grandfield, Tipton, Chattanooga, Randlett, Mountain Park, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Davidson, Manitou, and Devol. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
